kariminf.as.process.extraction

Class BayesClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • kariminf.as.process.extraction.BayesClassifier

  • public class BayesClassifier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to score each sentence in a text. Given a list of sentences, a list of features and a list of topics, this class is used to:
    • Add scoring features.
    • Calculate the probability that a sentence belongs to or represents a topic.
    • Calculate the probability that a sentence represents all the topics.

      • setFeatures

        public void setFeatures(java.util.List<Feature> features)
        Sets the list of features to be used to score a sentence

      • addFeature

        public void addFeature(Feature feature)
        Add a new feature to the list
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to be add

      • normalize

        public void normalize(boolean normalized)
        Sets whether normalizing the score or not. Normalizing is to divide the score by the length of the sentence
        Parameters:
        normalized - Normalize the score or not

      • classify

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> classify(Data data)
        Scores the sentences and reorder them from the more important to the less one. In order to use this method, the data container must contain preprocessed text. To do this, we must call the preprocessor first (See PreProcessor).
        Parameters:
        data - the data container
        Returns:
        a list of sentences' indexes ordered by importance

      • scoreSentInClass

        private java.lang.Double scoreSentInClass(Data data,
                                          int sentID,
                                          int classID)
        Calculates the score of a sentence in a class of topics The score of a sentence si in a class of topics cj having a set of features F is the production of scores of si in cj knowing each feature.

        P(si ∈ cj | F) = ∏k P(si ∈ cj | fk)

        Parameters:
        data - the data container
        sentID - sentence index (ID)
        classID - index (ID) of the class (topic).
        Returns:
        the score of a sentence in a class with a set of features.

      • scoreSentence

        public java.lang.Double scoreSentence(Data data,
                                      int sentID)
        Scores a sentence The score is the probability that a sentence si represents all the topics cj âˆˆ C knowing a set of features F.

        P(si ∈ ⋂j cj | F) = ∏j P(si ∈ cj | F)

        Parameters:
        data - the data container
        sentID - The index (ID) of the sentence to be scored
        Returns:
        the score of the sentence

      • train

        public void train(Data data)
        Trains Bayes classifier on the data, using a set of features
        Parameters:
        data - data container

        public java.lang.Double getScore(int sentID)
